bibl.title: Law and Enforcement in Ptolemaic Egypt.
bibl.note: Originally presented as a doctoral thesis, Duke Univ., 2005, under the title: Policing the Chora: Law Enforcement in Ptolemaic Egypt. - Preface. - 1. Introduction: The Place of Police. - 2. The Officer Corps I: The Phylakitai. - 3. The Officer Corps II: Civil and Military Police. - 4. Agents of Appeal: Petitions and Responses. - 5. Busting and Booking: Arrest, Investigation, Detention, Resolution. - 6. The Strong Arm of the Law:Security and Muscle. - 7. Conclusion. - Glossary. Index.
bibl.seg: John Bauschatz, Law and Enforcement in Ptolemaic Egypt.
Cambridge - New York, Cambridge University Press, 2013, 8Â°, xii-415 pp. ISBN 978-1-107-03713-7. $99.

Originally presented as a doctoral thesis, Duke Univ., 2005, under the title: Policing the Chora: Law Enforcement in Ptolemaic Egypt. - Preface. - 1. Introduction: The Place of Police. - 2. The Officer Corps I: The Phylakitai. - 3. The Officer Corps II: Civil and Military Police. - 4. Agents of Appeal: Petitions and Responses. - 5.
